data.text: spread over 7 trips i spent 2.3 y in india. usually that ended up experiencing a month of the blood hot Indian summer where compared to our heat waves are small beer. just like siesta in the southern countries, it is less common for shops and markets to be closed in the afternoon. Your first hint starts there: PREVENTION. make the most of the cool morning hours and the sunset hour. drinking water did not help. massive unsugarized yogurt drink and coconut water and freshly squeezed sugar cane juice and lemon water helped both to cool the body as well as mineralize it. my first meal was stuck: rijoe bananas, mangoes and some muesli soaked in milk. my dinner was more protein. rice with lentil mash and vegetables. Give your body time to get used to the higher temperatures. plan a few extra weeks if necessary so your schedule calms down
